definition: (coll.) wily old fox/crafty fellow

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
old fox/slick customer
a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world
sophisticate/man with extensive experience/child prodigy/Wunderkind (i.e. brilliant child)/spirit within a person (i.e. blood and essential breath 血氣|血气 of TCM)
cunning/crafty/wily old fox
annoying person/troublemaker/pain in the neck
soldier (from the two components of the 兵 character) (derog.)
an awkward person/a difficult person to deal with
hoodlum/person unfit for society
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
veteran
experienced person/an old hand at sth
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
crafty/slippery/slyboots
variant of 奸猾[jian1 hua2]
